sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews now, I'm Helena Humphrey and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Millions are plunged into darkness across eastern Ukraine after Russian strikes on electricity plants amid Kyiv's dramatic counter-offensive operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sweden's far right is set to make landmark gains with its best ever election results, though the final outcome from Sunday's poll isn't expected until Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the Queen's coffin is being taken to St Giles' Cathedral in Edinburgh,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: where it'll remain under a 24-hour vigil while King Charles makes his first address to the UK's parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says Russia has launched several cruise missiles, taking out two electricity plants and causing power cuts across the east of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The blackouts have reportedly affected around 9 million people in regions including Kharkiv and Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Zelenskyy accused Russia of terrorism and of attacking critical infrastructure, not military facilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The goal, he claimed, was to deprive people of light and heat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says the missile strikes are in response to its dramatic counter-offensive in Kharkiv province.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces claim to have recaptured about 3,000 square kilometers since the counteroffensive began earlier this month. Its troops are thought to be only 50 kilometers away from the Russian border. A Russian official in Belgorod region says thousands have fled the Kharkiv region into Russia as Ukrainian forces advance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Today, there are 1,342 people in 27 temporary accommodation centers in the region. We are preparing to send groups of 500, 250 people to other regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's Ministry of Defense said at the weekend it was regrouping its forces from Kharkiv to the Donetsk region just south to focus its military efforts there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The map shown in the broadcast highlighted a major withdrawal of the Russian army from Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, an unnamed Ukrainian prosecutor claims there is evidence of suspected Russian war crimes left behind in liberated villages in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police investigating the deaths of civilians say they may have been tortured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The last operational reactor at Ukraine's Zaporizhia nuclear plant has come to a grinding halt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Engineers shut down Power Unit 6 to avoid a radiation catastrophe as Europe's largest atomic site reconnects with Ukraine's electricity grid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This comes as the plant's reactors were purposely detached from their outside source of power a week ago after heavy shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: IAEA Director General Rafael Grossi has called for a safe zone to be created around the plant to avoid a potential disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On the 29th of August he led a team of experts to Zaporizhia in a bid to establish a permanent IAEA presence on the site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The band has been occupied by Russian forces since the early days of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's celebration time for the Sweden Democrats, the country's far-right anti-immigration party

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: that's set to send a strong message with its best-ever poll result with around a fifth of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But for now, they can only rely on exit polling as Sunday's election is so close that officials say the final outcome won't be known until Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's expected that a block of right wing parties, including the Sweden Democrats, will form a new government to defeat a left wing bloc that's ruled for eight years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We really are now a big party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I'm so proud and I'm so glad of what we have done together to achieve this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With around 90% of the vote now counted, many are anticipating this election will mark a shift towards the right in Sweden and the end of power for the coalition led by Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now Swedish democracy must take its course, all votes must be counted and we'll wait for a result.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the meantime, let's hope we had a good election, we had a good result and we had a fantastic campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thank you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Regardless of who comes out on top, Sweden is likely to face a lengthy process to form a government as it did after the 2018 election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Queen Elizabeth's coffin has been lying at rest overnight in the official royal residence in Edinburgh, the Palace of Holyrood House. It followed Sunday's six-hour long procession from Balmoral Castle, where Britain's longest-serving monarch died on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Large crowds had lined the route from Balmoral to the Scottish capital, the same is expected today when a procession will take the coffin to St. Giles Cathedral, attended by King Charles and members of the Royal Family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The coffin will remain under a 24-hour vigil to allow members of the public to pay their respects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, who was among those watching the Queen's cortege pass through Edinburgh, is due to have her first audience with the new King later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: audience with the new King later today. On Tuesday the focus will turn on Buckingham Palace where floral tributes continue to be laid at the Palace gates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Queen's coffin is to be flown to London ahead of a four day lying in state in Westminster Hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Queen's state funeral is on Monday September 19th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile King Charles has held his first reception for the Secretary General of the Commonwealth at Buckingham Palace. Together with his wife Camilla, the Queen Consort, the royal couple received the High Commissioners from the countries of which he is head of state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a week's time the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II will take place here at London's Westminster Abbey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is expected to be one of the largest funerals in history, with a TV audience into the billions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over the coming days, though, there will be a lot going on here in the United Kingdom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: though, there will be a lot going on here in the U.S. Kingdom. The Queen's body is currently in Edinburgh, the Scottish capital, where it will lie in state in a cathedral from today for the next 24 hours, where members of the public will be able to queue up and slowly pass by to pay their respects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Then the Queen's daughter, Princess Anne, will fly with the body on a RAF jet down from Edinburgh back here to London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And on Tuesday night, it will spend a night at Buckingham Palace before then moving to the Palace of Westminster, where the House of Commons and House of Lords is, to a hall called Westminster Hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It dates back almost a thousand years to the Norman invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it is where both the Queen's mother and father laid in state in decades gone by. The coffin will be placed in the centre of Westminster Hall. There will be a 24-hour guard surrounding it with some of the crown jewels placed on top and 24 hours a day members of the public will be able to queue up to process past the coffin to pay their respects until Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Then as I said next, the funeral will take place here behind me at Westminster Abbey. It is expected that perhaps over 100 heads of nations and governments will be traveling to London. The streets of London are expected to be packed. There will be millions coming to pay their respects to a queen who 70 years ago was crowned in this Westminster Abbey behind me and will have her final public ceremony here before a private burial at her home in Windsor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vincent McIverney, Euronews, London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As Australia formally proclaims its new monarch, Britain's King Charles III,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As Australia formally proclaims its new monarch, Britain's King Charles III, the death of Queen Elizabeth II has reignited the Republican debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been previously vocal about wanting the country to have an Australian head of state, but he says not right now. Well, my views on that, of course, are well known and well documented. But now is not a time to talk about our system of government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now is a time for us to pay tribute to the life of Queen Elizabeth, a life well lived.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Also today, we will be, of course, commemorating the proclamation of King Charles III as Australia's head of state. That's the system of government that we have. It's one which as Australian Prime Minister I have a responsibility to respect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: God save the King.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: New Zealand has also officially recognised its new king. The faraway nations are two of just 15 Commonwealth countries where the monarch is still head of state.
